message_1:
Suppose we have a plaintext "DANCE" and it is encrypted using the Hill Cipher with key matrix 
$$\begin{bmatrix} 5 & 8 \\ 17 & 3 \end{bmatrix}$$
Find the corresponding ciphertext.
message_2:
To encrypt the plaintext "DANCE" using the Hill Cipher with the given key matrix, we first need to convert the letters to their numerical equivalents (A=0, B=1, C=2, ..., Z=25). Then, we will group the plaintext into pairs and multiply each pair by the key matrix to obtain the ciphertext.

D = 3, A = 0, N = 13, C = 2, E = 4

Plaintext pairs: (3, 0), (13, 2), (4, -)

Since we have an odd number of letters in the plaintext, we can add an extra letter (e.g., X = 23) to make the last pair.

Plaintext pairs: (3, 0), (13, 2), (4, 23)

Now, we will multiply each pair by the key matrix:

$$\begin{bmatrix} 5 & 8 \\ 17 & 3 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} 3 \\ 0 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 15 \\ 51 \end{bmatrix} \pmod{26} = \begin{bmatrix} 15 \\ 25 \end{bmatrix}$$

$$\begin{bmatrix} 5 & 8 \\ 17 & 3 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} 13 \\ 2 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 121 \\ 227 \end{bmatrix} \pmod{26} = \begin{bmatrix} 1 \\ 11 \end{bmatrix}$$

$$\begin{bmatrix} 5 & 8 \\ 17 & 3 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} 4 \\ 23 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 196 \\ 95 \end{bmatrix} \pmod{26} = \begin{bmatrix} 0 \\ 21 \end{bmatrix}$$

Now, we convert the numerical values back to letters:

15 = P, 25 = Z, 1 = B, 11 = L, 0 = A, 21 = V

The corresponding ciphertext is "PZBLAV".
